intro: Oldenlandia rufescens, commonly known as the redstem spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial species characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and a prominent central stamen, which gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open fields. Its rapid growth and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for gardens in suitable climates.
